titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that the Sikh nation should be allowed to exercise the right of self-determination for the independence of their homeland, Punjab, Khalistan.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Asia and the Pacific.

bill.summary: 8/5/1993--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that: (1) the Sikhs of Khalistan have the right to self-determination and should be allowed to exercise this right by pursuing the independence of their homeland, Punjab, Khalistan; and (2) the United Nations should hold a plebiscite in the Sikh homeland so that Sikhs can determine their own political future.
